\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}
Description of a Allocator to be created. 

\doxysubsection{Member Function Documentation}
\mbox{\Hypertarget{structVmaAllocatorCreateInfo_a82466e83a09c9c49da27e8ba0f733794}\label{structVmaAllocatorCreateInfo_a82466e83a09c9c49da27e8ba0f733794}} 
\index{VmaAllocatorCreateInfo@{VmaAllocatorCreateInfo}!VMA\_LEN\_IF\_NOT\_NULL@{VMA\_LEN\_IF\_NOT\_NULL}}
\index{VMA\_LEN\_IF\_NOT\_NULL@{VMA\_LEN\_IF\_NOT\_NULL}!VmaAllocatorCreateInfo@{VmaAllocatorCreateInfo}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{VMA\_LEN\_IF\_NOT\_NULL()}{VMA\_LEN\_IF\_NOT\_NULL()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily const Vk\+Device\+Size$\ast$ VMA\+\_\+\+NULLABLE Vma\+Allocator\+Create\+Info\+::\+VMA\+\_\+\+LEN\+\_\+\+IF\+\_\+\+NOT\+\_\+\+NULL (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{\char`\"{}Vk\+Physical\+Device\+Memory\+Properties\+::memory\+Heap\+Count\char`\"{}}]{ }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Either null or a pointer to an array of limits on maximum number of bytes that can be allocated out of particular Vulkan memory heap. 

If not NULL, it must be a pointer to an array of {\ttfamily Vk\+Physical\+Device\+Memory\+Properties\+::memory\+Heap\+Count} elements, defining limit on maximum number of bytes that can be allocated out of particular Vulkan memory heap.

Any of the elements may be equal to {\ttfamily VK\+\_\+\+WHOLE\+\_\+\+SIZE}, which means no limit on that heap. This is also the default in case of {\ttfamily p\+Heap\+Size\+Limit} = NULL.

If there is a limit defined for a heap\+:


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item If user tries to allocate more memory from that heap using this allocator, the allocation fails with {\ttfamily VK\+\_\+\+ERROR\+\_\+\+OUT\+\_\+\+OF\+\_\+\+DEVICE\+\_\+\+MEMORY}.
\item If the limit is smaller than heap size reported in {\ttfamily Vk\+Memory\+Heap\+::size}, the value of this limit will be reported instead when using vma\+Get\+Memory\+Properties().
\end{DoxyItemize}

Warning! Using this feature may not be equivalent to installing a GPU with smaller amount of memory, because graphics driver doesn\textquotesingle{}t necessary fail new allocations with {\ttfamily VK\+\_\+\+ERROR\+\_\+\+OUT\+\_\+\+OF\+\_\+\+DEVICE\+\_\+\+MEMORY} result when memory capacity is exceeded. It may return success and just silently migrate some device memory blocks to system RAM. This driver behavior can also be controlled using VK\+\_\+\+AMD\+\_\+memory\+\_\+overallocation\+\_\+behavior extension.

\index{VmaAllocatorCreateInfo@{VmaAllocatorCreateInfo}!frameInUseCount@{frameInUseCount}}
\index{frameInUseCount@{frameInUseCount}!VmaAllocatorCreateInfo@{VmaAllocatorCreateInfo}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{frameInUseCount}{frameInUseCount}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily uint32\+\_\+t Vma\+Allocator\+Create\+Info\+::frame\+In\+Use\+Count}



Maximum number of additional frames that are in use at the same time as current frame. 

This value is used only when you make allocations with VMA\+\_\+\+ALLOCATION\+\_\+\+CREATE\+\_\+\+CAN\+\_\+\+BECOME\+\_\+\+LOST\+\_\+\+BIT flag. Such allocation cannot become lost if allocation.\+last\+Use\+Frame\+Index $>$= allocator.\+current\+Frame\+Index -\/ frame\+In\+Use\+Count.

For example, if you double-\/buffer your command buffers, so resources used for rendering in previous frame may still be in use by the GPU at the moment you allocate resources needed for the current frame, set this value to 1.

If you want to allow any allocations other than used in the current frame to become lost, set this value to 0. \mbox{\Hypertarget{structVmaAllocatorCreateInfo_aa2d4e3d86e6828834a56cf9f9406149a}\label{structVmaAllocatorCreateInfo_aa2d4e3d86e6828834a56cf9f9406149a}}

{\footnotesize\ttfamily const \mbox{\hyperlink{structVmaRecordSettings}{Vma\+Record\+Settings}}$\ast$ VMA\+\_\+\+NULLABLE Vma\+Allocator\+Create\+Info\+::p\+Record\+Settings}



Parameters for recording of VMA calls. Can be null. 

If not null, it enables recording of calls to VMA functions to a file. If support for recording is not enabled using {\ttfamily VMA\+\_\+\+RECORDING\+\_\+\+ENABLED} macro, creation of the allocator object fails with {\ttfamily VK\+\_\+\+ERROR\+\_\+\+FEATURE\+\_\+\+NOT\+\_\+\+PRESENT}. \mbox{\Hypertarget{structVmaAllocatorCreateInfo_a8e4714298e3121cdd8b214a1ae7a637a}\label{structVmaAllocatorCreateInfo_a8e4714298e3121cdd8b214a1ae7a637a}}

\index{VmaAllocatorCreateInfo@{VmaAllocatorCreateInfo}!vulkanApiVersion@{vulkanApiVersion}}
\index{vulkanApiVersion@{vulkanApiVersion}!VmaAllocatorCreateInfo@{VmaAllocatorCreateInfo}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{vulkanApiVersion}{vulkanApiVersion}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily uint32\+\_\+t Vma\+Allocator\+Create\+Info\+::vulkan\+Api\+Version}



Optional. The highest version of Vulkan that the application is designed to use. 

It must be a value in the format as created by macro {\ttfamily VK\+\_\+\+MAKE\+\_\+\+VERSION} or a constant like\+: {\ttfamily VK\+\_\+\+API\+\_\+\+VERSION\+\_\+1\+\_\+1}, {\ttfamily VK\+\_\+\+API\+\_\+\+VERSION\+\_\+1\+\_\+0}. The patch version number specified is ignored. Only the major and minor versions are considered. It must be less or equal (preferably equal) to value as passed to {\ttfamily vk\+Create\+Instance} as {\ttfamily Vk\+Application\+Info\+::api\+Version}. Only versions 1.\+0 and 1.\+1 are supported by the current implementation. Leaving it initialized to zero is equivalent to {\ttfamily VK\+\_\+\+API\+\_\+\+VERSION\+\_\+1\+\_\+0}.
